column4: English help wanted: What does it mean to 'assert a bit in a status register'? Is there another word here for 'to assert'?
set possibly?
because one might not be set up on it
I do not know the phrase: "to be set up on sth." Please rephrase your answer so that I can understand it.
I don't know what you're asking
your eth0 interface might not have an address set
How can an network interface be active without having an internet address?
easily
Can you elaborate.
what if you weren't using it for TCP/IP ?
I can only use interfaces vis TCP/IP. Anything else is obsolete.
I suppose you've never used a NAS then
It is true that I have never used a Netware Access Server. But this irrelevant for finding the answer to the question put.
not Netware, NAS
network attached storage
I have some computers here with two ethernet NICs in, one of which has no IP address set
the one with no IP address is only used for raw Ethernet frames
Thank you for commenting.
Please try to read. I have not been impatient.
you have been rather rude, though
you already asked that, and i already told you the answer
No. You did not.
